question: The "Three Parallel Rivers of Yunnan Protected Areas", a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is located in which nation?
explanation: Three Parallel Rivers of Yunnan Protected Areas is a UNESCO World Heritage Site located in the Yunnan province of China. It is located inside Three Parallel Rivers National Park. This area forms the upper reaches of the three rivers of the Asia-the Yangtze, the Mekong and the Salween rivers running parallelly. This area is considered as an epicentre of Chinese biodiversity. It has one of the richest temperate regions in the world.
